channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: TikTok Says U.S. Employees Will Have Jobs Even if the App Is Banned
item.description: The company is awaiting a decision over the constitutionality of a new law that aims to force a sale of the app to a non-Chinese owner under the threa...

item.title: Musk Said to Have Intervened to Help Free Italian Jailed in Iran
item.description: The Italian journalist was released soon after Elon Musk met with an Iranian ambassador, officials in Iran said. So was an Iranian detained in Italy w...

item.title: Supreme Court Seems Ready to Back Texas Law Limiting Access to Pornography
item.description: The law, meant to shield minors from sexual materials on the internet by requiring adults to prove they are 18, was challenged on First Amendment grou...

item.title: What Does the Gaza Cease-Fire Deal Between Israel and Hamas Say?
item.description: In the first phase, 33 hostages and hundreds of Palestinian prisoners would be freed, and hundreds of trucks with humanitarian aid would be allowed in...

item.title: Washington Post Employees Plead With Jeff Bezos to Meet
item.description: In a letter, more than 400 employees asked Mr. Bezos, the company’s owner, to meet, saying they were “deeply alarmed” by recent decisions at the paper...

item.title: How snack giant Mondelez is trying to keep pace in the fast-changing realm of AI, cybersecurity, and cloud
item.description: The company's CTO and CISO shares insight about managing a huge tech operation within a Fortune 500 business.

item.title: FDA bans red dye No. 3 from foods, supplements, and some medicines because of potential cancer risk
item.description: The agency said it was taking the action as a “matter of law” because some studies have found that the dye caused cancer in lab rats.

item.title: Trump and Biden both rush to take credit for the Gaza ceasefire. One expert calls it ‘ironic’
item.description: Biden said the agreement was the result of "dogged and painstaking American diplomacy." Trump said it only happened because he won the election.

item.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX is still causing flight delays years after a single rocket launch disrupted 563 planes
item.description: SpaceX’s Falcon Heavy launch in 2018 caused 4,645 minutes, or more than 77 hours, of commercial flight delays.

item.title: Takeaways From Marco Rubio’s Senate Hearing

item.title: Thursday Briefing: A Gaza Cease-Fire Deal
Live Updates: Israel and Hamas Reach Cease-Fire Deal, Biden Says
item.description: The prime minister of Qatar, a key mediator, said the agreement would come into effect on Sunday, and President Biden said it would last for 42 days. ...

item.title: Bitcoin rebounds to $100,000 as inflation data puts Fed rate cuts ‘back on the table’
item.description: The original cryptocurrency has risen 9% since hitting a 30-day low of $90,600.

item.title: N.Y.P.D. Bans High-Speed Chases for Low-Level Offenses
